name: Aravinda de Silva
bio: Deshabandu Pinnaduwage Aravinda de Silva (Sinhala: අරවින්ද ද සිල්වා; born 17 October 1965) is a former Sri Lankan cricketer and a captain, who has also played in English county cricket and he is widely recognized as one of the most elegant and stylish right-handed batsmen ever. De Silva helped Sri Lanka to win the 1996 Cricket World Cup and brought Sri Lanka from underdog status to present-day form. He has held various posts in Sri Lanka Cricket after his retirement in 2003.[1]
